title: Bbc Eastenders Legend 'To Die In Disaster' - And It'S Not Martin Fowler
summary: EastEnders fans are concerned about the fate of character Jean Slater due to her recent absence and her daughter's uneasy behavior. Jean's struggle with bipolar disorder has left viewers anxious about her mental health, with some speculating she may be written out of the show during its 40th anniversary week.

title: 'Put Your Worries To Rest', Says London Spirit Investor
summary: A consortium led by Nikesh Arora has invested £145m in the London Spirit team of The Hundred cricket tournament. Arora assured fans that they have no plans to harm the franchise and want to make the matches exciting and popular. The investment is seen as a long-term decision with potential growth in the future.

title: West London Council Tenants Face Rent Increase - How Costs Compare To Renting Privately
summary: Hammersmith and Fulham council tenants will face a 2.7% rent increase starting April, with an average weekly rise of £3.65. This remains below private rents. Service charges and heating costs will decrease for some tenants. The HRA budget for 2025/26 and a 10-year plan were approved, including £850m investment in housing and £12.3m new investment in the revenue budget. Contingencies are built into the housing budget.

title: Mum Would Want Me To Talk About Cancer - Mead
summary: Arsenal and England winger Beth Mead supports a public health campaign to eliminate cervical cancer by 2040, inspired by her late mother who passed away from ovarian and cervical cancer. The campaign, 'defend your tomorrow', aims to raise awareness during the north London derby. Mead prioritizes getting into the Champions League places this season.

title: Jordan Group Buys London Irish Out Of Administration
summary: London Irish Rugby Club have been bought out of administration by a consortium led by former Formula 1 team owner and businessman Eddie Jordan.In June 2023 London Irish were forced out of the Premiers...

title: Havertz To Be Assessed Amid Fears He Could Miss Rest Of Season
summary: Arsenal's top scorer, Kai Havertz, may miss the rest of the season due to a muscle injury, potentially worsening their attacking struggles and disappointing fans and pundits who had already criticized the club for not signing a striker in the January transfer window.

title: 'Inbetweener' Cats On Waste Ground Need New Homes
summary: A charity is seeking new homes for a colony of 15 "inbetweener" cats facing eviction from a triangle of waste ground in Lewisham, due to development. The cats, aged between 10 months and 5 years old, have already been neutered. Cats Protection is asking for people with large and safe gardens or businesses with outdoor spaces to consider rehoming them in pairs. The cats are shy and will shy away from being touched, but may interact with their caregivers if given time and space.

title: Thames Water Admits Delays To Environmental Works
summary: Thames Water is under investigation by Ofwat after the company admitted it will not complete more than 100 environmental schemes funded by customers.The regulator will look into whether delays to the ...

title: Heathrow Expects Third Runway Take Offs In 10 Years
summary: Heathrow Airport plans to expand with a third runway, aiming for take-offs within 10 years. This move, backed by the Chancellor, has angered environmental campaigners. Heathrow has committed to using UK-made steel for new infrastructure amid concerns over US tariffs. The project faces opposition from environmental groups, politicians, and local authorities. The aviation industry is under pressure to reduce its impact on climate change. Heathrow's expansion could increase flights from 480,000 to 720,000 per year.

title: Waste To Pay Officers We Can'T Sack, Says Met Chief
summary: It is a "ridiculous waste of taxpayers' money" to pay for police officers who cannot be sacked to sit at home, Metropolitan Police Commissioner Sir Mark Rowley has said.The High Court ruled on Tuesday...

title: Increased Tfl Penalty Fares Working, Mayor Claims
summary: Increased penalty fines for fare dodging are having a positive impact and the measure is working as an "effective deterrent", the Mayor of London has said.In March last year, penalty fares increased f...

title: Thousands Left Without Water After Major Pipe Bursts
summary: A pipe burst in Crystal Palace, Lambeth has left thousands of homes and businesses without water. Thames Water is working to restore water supply and deliver bottled water to priority services, including care homes and schools. Flooding from a separate issue at Crystal Palace Pumping Station is adding to the supply problems.

title: £54M Securitas Robber Shot In Neck At Home - Court
summary: A former cagefighter convicted of Britain's largest cash robbery was shot in the neck in his kitchen in east London following his release from jail, a court has heard.Paul Allen, then 41, was paralyse...

title: King Told He'S 'Bigger Than Beyoncé' At Spurs Visit
summary: King Charles visited Tottenham Hotspur stadium, meeting with local business owners and students. He received praise for his support of the community and had a go at throwing an American football.

title: Pair Deny Damaging Darwin'S Westminster Abbey Grave
summary: Two pensioners denied damaging Charles Darwin's grave in Westminster Abbey by spraying it with orange chalk paint, writing "1.5 is dead" as a protest against climate change. The church does not anticipate permanent damage.

title: Three Girls Sexually Assaulted Near Clapham Common
summary: A man has been arrested for sexually assaulting three girls near Clapham Common in Lambeth. The incidents occurred on January 8 and 23, and police are asking for other potential victims to come forward.

title: Amazon Bans Number Plates As Illegal Supply Found
summary: Online retailer Amazon is banning the sale of car number plates on its platform after a BBC London investigation exposed they were being illegally supplied.The BBC found seven companies on the platfor...

title: Rogue Officers On Paid Leave 'Could Cost Millions'
summary: The Metropolitan Police Commissioner has warned that the cost of keeping rogue officers on paid leave could reach tens of millions of pounds a year, with 29 officers currently on paid leave and 96 who have been sacked or resigned. The Met is facing significant cuts to frontline services, but the scale has been reduced due to additional government funding. The mayor's draft budget proposes raising council tax bills to help pay for London's police and fire services.

title: Beloved Putney Shop Closing After Nearly 30 Years Due To 'Unsustainable' Budget
summary: A family-owned gift shop in Putney, Huttons, is closing after nearly 30 years due to the unsustainability of the current retail environment following the Autumn Budget. The budget raised employer's National Insurance contributions, lowered business relief rates, and increased National Minimum Wage, causing retail bosses to warn of a shrinking UK sector, job losses, and slowed wage growth.

title: James Blunt At London O2 Arena Timings, Set List And Last-Minute Tickets
summary:
Celebrating the 20th anniversary of his iconic Back to Bedlam album, James Blunt will return to London's The O2 this week. He'll be performing at the venue on Sunday, February 16.
The artist will play...

title: Travel Alert Issued For Anyone Going To Turkey, Egypt, Uae And Dubai Ahead Of Ramadan
summary: The Foreign Office has issued a travel alert for Brits planning to visit Turkey, Egypt, and the UAE during Ramadan in 2025. The alert advises caution regarding public behavior, such as eating, drinking, or smoking, and recommends checking shop and restaurant opening times. Driving behavior may become more unpredictable, and dressing conservatively is advised. The start date of Ramadan in 2025 is predicted to be March 1, but it may vary depending on a moon sighting.

title: Should Parents Face Fines Of £2,500 For Taking Children On Holiday During Term Time?
summary: Parents across the UK have been given a stark warning that they could be hit with fines of up to £2,500 for repeatedly taking their children out of school. A staggering 443,000 fines were handed out i...

title: Retro Console Repair Shop As Nostalgia Trend Booms
summary: A free repair shop for retro consoles from the '90s and '00s has been launched in Southwark, as nostalgia for retro tech increases. The event runs until 8pm on February 12, at Four Quarters Elephant Park, and is strictly 18+.

title: Pensions Expert Urges All Parents To Do 3 Things To Get £720 Free A Year
summary: An ethical finance firm suggests a tax hack that could entitle people in the UK to £720 in free pension cash by contributing up to £2,880 a year to a children's or personal pension, potentially boosting retirement savings.

title: Shepherd'S Bush Stabbing Live Updates As Goldhawk Road Closed With Man Arrested
summary:
A man has been stabbed in Shepherd's Bush. Police raced to Goldhawk Road at about 1pm today (Wednesday, February 12) to reports of the knife attack.
There they found the victim in the street and he's ...

title: King Shows Off His Passing Skills As He Visits Home Of Tottenham Hotspur
summary: King Charles III visited Tottenham Hotspur stadium in Haringey, meeting with community members and ex-offenders supported by his trust. He also threw an American football with a professional player, showcasing his enthusiasm for local initiatives.

title: Immigration Changes Would ‘Deny’ Paddington Bear A Passport, Labour Mp Warns
summary: A Labour MP has warned that changes to immigration rules would “deny” Paddington Bear from obtaining a British passport. The Home Office’s good character guidance now states that an applicant will “no...

summary:
Mountain Warehouse shoppers are loving a coat that's the perfect addition to your spring wardrobe. And its price has just been slashed as part of the retailer's ongoing sales.
The Hilltop II Womens Wa...

title: Little Simz Curating 'Epic' Meltdown Festival At Southbank Centre
summary: Rapper Little Simz is curating the Meltdown festival at the Southbank Centre in Islington, featuring live performances and workshops. This is a positive event for the local community and a recognition of Simz's influence in London's music scene.

title: The Long Forgotten London Underground Station Hidden Behind A Brewery
summary: Walthamstow has always been a bit of a transport hub. Hop on the Tube at Walthamstow Central and you'll find yourself in the heart of London in a mere 15 minutes, or even quicker if you're starting fr...

title: John Lewis To Sell Harry Styles-Backed Brand In Bid To Lift Fashion Credentials
summary: John Lewis, a UK-based retailer, is partnering with 49 new brands, including a Harry Styles-backed fashion label, to improve its fashion credentials and revive clothing sales. The move is part of an effort to modernize its offer under recently appointed boss Peter Ruis. The new brands include SS Daley, NN07, and Norse Projects. John Lewis will sell around 350 fashion brands, alongside its own-label ranges.

title: The North London Nursery School Where Kids Can Be Read To 'Whenever They Pick Up A Book'
summary:
A leading London nursery school has been praised for its pupils' "excellent" behaviour and kids can be read to 'whenever they pick up a book', following its latest Ofsted inspection.
Kate Greenaway Nu...

title: Massive 6.5Ft-Long Snakes Invading Uk Spotted Wild In London For First Time In Thousands Of Years
summary: Aesculapian snakes, a non-venomous species from central and southern Europe, have returned to the UK after thousands of years due to climate change and human transport. They have been found in London and North Wales, seeking shelter in unexpected places like attics and garden compost bins. These snakes primarily feed on rodents and can grow up to six-and-a-half feet long.

title: Met Police Chief Hits Out At Middle-Class Drug Users Putting Kids 'In Coffins' To Put Cocaine On Their Table
summary: London’s police chief has hit out at middle-class drug users who 'put young people in coffins’ so they can enjoy a line of cocaine on the weekend. Taking questions from Assembly Members at the Police...

title: The London Funeral Company Offering Burials In 'Living' Pods Made From Fungi
summary: A new eco-friendly burial option is available in Southwark, London. The 'living coffin' is made from fungi and decomposes in just 45 days. Poetic Endings funeral home is the first in the UK to stock these innovative coffins, which have received positive feedback. GreenAcres and Loop Biotech also offer this sustainable burial option in the UK.

title: Smashing Pumpkins Announce Huge London 2025 Outdoor Gig - Full Line Up And How To Get Tickets
summary: The Smashing Pumpkins have announced a huge open-air show taking place this summer at London’s Gunnersbury Park on Sunday, August 10. Supported by Skunk Anansie and White Lies, the Chicago band will b...

title: Person Dies After Being Hit By Train Near Richmond
summary: A person has died after being hit by a train near Richmond, causing significant disruption to train services. The incident is not being treated as suspicious, and support resources for mental health are provided.

title: Lambeth Council Workers Left ‘In Tears’ After Ltn Meeting, Court Hears
summary: Lambeth Council workers were offered a wellbeing day after “hostility and anger” at a meeting over a proposed Low Traffic Neighbourhood (LTN) scheme left them “in tears”, the High Court has heard. Res...

title: Dua Lipa Makes Statement Following Bizarre Duolingo Owl 'Death'
summary: Dua Lipa and other celebrities have reacted to the "death" of Duo, the Duolingo owl mascot, in a PR stunt by the language learning app. Duo was known for reminding users to complete their daily lessons and was regularly featured in the app's marketing. Duolingo has announced the cause of death as a Tesla Cybertruck, but the purpose of the stunt is unclear.

title: Louise Thompson'S Better Than 'Botox' Cream That Gives 'Glass Skin'
summary: Louise Thompson, a former Made In Chelsea star, shared her skincare secret - Erborian's BB cream. The Korean-French brand's product is a skincare-makeup hybrid that leaves a velvet finish, contains SPF20, and has received positive reviews from beauty fans. However, one user with sensitive skin reported skin irritation.

title: Tfl'S Full Spending On Rebranding Buses For Superloop Routes - One Alone Cost Over £130K
summary: Transport for London spent £1.14 million on rebranding buses and bus stops for the Superloop scheme, with costs for vinyl wraps on buses ranging from £60,955 to £130,795. The number of journeys on one route has increased since the service began in July 2023.

title: Candidates Named Ahead Of Alperton By-Election - Greens Keep Promise To Stand Down Candidate
summary: A by-election is taking place in Alperton, Brent. Four candidates are running, representing the Liberal Democrats, Labour, Conservatives, and Reform Party. The candidates have identified issues such as flytipping, street drinking, housing affordability, and community investment as important for the area.

title: The North London Council Spending £100K A Day On Temporary Housing - 33K Households Wait For A Home
summary: Brent Council spends £100,000 a day on temporary housing due to a growing population and high demand for social housing. The council has identified housing as a key financial pressure, with 33,000 households on its waiting list. The average wait time for a two-bedroom home is over a decade. The council is building homes but the number is far below the required 5,041 new homes to tackle the crisis. Without additional support from the government, Brent Council suggests the consequences for local authorities will be 'bankruptcy'.

title: Met Police Officer Fired For Misogynistic Group Chat Suggesting Violence Against Women
summary: A Met Police officer was fired for participating in a misogynistic group chat with other officers, which included inappropriate and offensive messages about women. The panel noted the messages continued despite public scrutiny of police culture following Sarah Everard's murder. The officer admitted gross misconduct, but two other officers denied their messages were grossly offensive. The panel found the opposition to the messages was not sufficient and the officers showed a lack of responsibility.

title: Boy, 17, Shot In Croydon Street Attack As Met Police Hunt Gunman
summary: A 17-year-old boy was shot and injured in Croydon, London. The incident occurred on February 10, 2023, near the junction of High Street and Park Street. The victim's condition is potentially life-changing. No arrests have been made. Witnesses report frequent violent incidents in the area.

title: London Heathrow To Get Upgraded Terminals In Multi-Billion Pound Investment Ahead Of New Runway Plan
summary: Heathrow airport in Hillingdon is set to announce a multi-billion pound investment for upgrades and expansion, including terminal capacity increases, airfield layout reconfiguration, and transportation improvements. This comes in preparation for a new runway proposal and is expected to boost UK investment and economic growth. Heathrow aims to carry out the project responsibly with strict environmental safeguards.

title: Arsenal'S Kelly Left Out Of England'S Nations League Squad
summary: Chloe Kelly has been left out of England's Women's Nations League squad due to not playing enough for her new club Arsenal. Lauren James, Ella Toone, and Nikita Parris have been called up. Georgia Stanway is out due to injury. The squad includes players from various WSL teams.

title: Chelsea Striker Kerr Cleared Of Racial Harassment
summary: Chelsea striker Sam Kerr was found not guilty of causing racially aggravated harassment after calling a police officer "stupid and white". The incident occurred in Twickenham, South-West London, in January 2023. Kerr apologized for expressing herself poorly but maintained she did not intend to insult or harm anyone. The trial revealed attempts to get the case thrown out due to an abuse of process by crown prosecutors.

title: Man'S Pop-Up Urinal Death May Never Be Explained, Family Fears
summary: A maintenance engineer was killed in a freak accident in Soho while working on a pop-up urinal. His family is seeking answers about the cause of his death and expresses distress over the delay in the investigation. The incident occurred while working for Westminster City Council, and a Health and Safety Executive spokesperson is assisting the Metropolitan Police investigation.

title: 'When The Wind Blows At Grenfell, I Feel My Dad'
summary: The article discusses the personal impact of the Grenfell Tower fire, focusing on the emotional response of the author when the wind blows in the area.

title: 'I Have To Shower At The Gym' - Disabled People Wait For Simple Home Changes
summary: On a cold and wet evening, Sam Lewis walks to her local gym for a shower. It is a painful and slow journey, using a walking stick.The 34-year-old's rheumatoid arthritis means she risks falling when cl...

title: Over 100 E-Bikes Seized To Combat Pavement Blocking
summary: City of London Corporation seizes over 100 rental e-bikes obstructing pavements and roads, with companies able to collect their products after paying a fee. The corporation is committed to adding 300 additional parking spaces for e-bikes.

title: Runway Hopes Reignite Heathrow Southern Rail Plan
summary: Plans for a new railway connecting Heathrow to Surrey have resurfaced, aiming to increase connectivity and reduce surface emissions. The Heathrow Southern Railway (HSR) would operate between Heathrow and London Waterloo via Staines, with direct trains to Woking and Guildford. The project, privately financed and estimated to cut millions of road journeys, is backed by the government as part of its plans to boost the UK's economy.

title: Family 'Heartbroken' As Missing Sailor Named As London Father
summary: Family of British sailor, Charles Todd, mourns his death after his boat capsized off the south-west coast of France. Todd was a member of the Greenwich Yacht Club for over a decade.

title: London Vegan Restaurant To Get Michelin Star
summary: A vegan restaurant in Hackney, Plates London, has become the first vegan restaurant in the UK to receive a Michelin star. Nine restaurants in London received their first star, and two received a second star. The Ritz Restaurant in Westminster received two stars, and Soho's Humble Chicken received a second star. This year's ceremony was held as the Michelin Guide celebrates its 125th anniversary.

title: Woman Wins £95K Settlement After Moped Collision
summary: "Everything seems to have stopped, and my life is not the same any more."More than two years after being hit by a moped while on her way to a Mother's Day dinner with her sons in 2022, Loraine White f...

title: King Praises School Allergy Scheme After Teen Death
summary: King Charles supports a new allergy awareness program for schools, launched by the parents of a teen who died from a severe allergic reaction. The program aims to train teachers and staff to better understand and deal with food allergies, as many teachers have little food allergy awareness. The program will also provide educational films, first aid advice, and lesson plans.

title: Rape Accused Urged Victim To Drink Alcohol - Court
summary: A Chinese PhD student is accused of drugging and raping 10 women, including three in London. The alleged incidents occurred after the suspect encouraged the victims to drink alcohol. The trial is ongoing.

title: Man Denies Murdering His Six-Year-Old Daughter
summary: A father from Camden, London is on trial for the murder of his six-year-old daughter, who suffered serious injuries when she was eight weeks old. The father, Kyle Kitchen, has denied the charges. The mother, Kenzey Kane, was found guilty of causing or allowing serious injury to a child. Their daughter died from her injuries in 2021.

title: Un Concern After Activists Accused Of Terror Laws Link
summary: The UN has expressed concern over the detention of activists under anti-terrorism laws. The activists are accused of damaging property at a facility allegedly supplying arms to Israel. They were denied legal support, family visits, and healthcare. The Home Office stated there is sufficient evidence of a terrorism connection. The UN has raised concerns about potential human rights violations during their detention.

title: Chelsea Star Sam Kerr Cleared Of Racial Harassment
summary: Chelsea striker Sam Kerr has been found not guilty of causing racially aggravated harassment, after calling a Metropolitan Police officer "stupid and white".A jury at Kingston Crown Court cleared her ...

title: Policing In 'Hopeless Position' After Court Ruling On Vetting, Met Chief Says
summary: The High Court ruled that an officer accused of rape cannot be dismissed due to an unfair vetting process, leaving the Metropolitan Police in a "hopeless position". The officer, who denied the allegations, cannot be trusted to work with women or enter the homes of vulnerable people. The ruling has major implications for the ability of police chiefs to sack officers and is a blow to the Met's pledge to root out unfit individuals. The force plans to appeal the decision.

title: London To Get New 33-Storey Offices With Food Venues, Pop-Up Market And Public Viewing Gallery
summary: Plans for a 33-story office block at 70 Gracechurch Street in the City of London have been approved, with substantial elements of the existing structure retained. The development includes food and drink spots, a public viewing gallery, and a pop-up market. The project is expected to deliver a world-class, sustainable office development, enhancing the eastern cluster and creating a vibrant new gateway to Leadenhall Market.

title: ’I Was Slapped With A £625 Ulez Charge Even Though I Drive An Electric Car'
summary: A London grandad was charged £625 for emissions even though he drives an electric car. The man from Hampton, near the ULEZ zone, was given a personalized number plate for his electric MG ZS ride by his children. He was charged for both the Low Emission Zone (LEZ) and Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) due to a mistake from a previous owner who might have operated a commercial vehicle across the Irish Sea. TfL has since refunded the charges.

title: Met Police Detective Who Appeared In Bbc Rape Documentary Made Rape Threats To Partners, Tribunal Told
summary: A Metropolitan Police detective, who worked at a unit investigating sex offences, abused, harassed, and made rape threats to former partners, a tribunal heard. Detective Constable David Fall, who work...

title: Construction Of Step-Free Access Resumes At West London Station After Being Halted 5 Years Ago
summary: Construction of step-free access has resumed at Northolt Station in Hillingdon, with a new footbridge, left, and boarding ramps to improve accessibility. The project is part of wider work to add step-free stations on the TfL network, with station staff present during construction. The public toilets will close in April 2025, and the work is expected to be completed in Summer 2026.

title: Woman, 27, Named As Victim Of Clapton Crash After Car Hit Bus
summary: A 27-year-old woman, Soriah Berry, died after her car collided with a bus in Clapton, Hackney. The incident occurred near the junction of Lea Bridge Road and Clapton Road. The Metropolitan Police and Transport for London are investigating the crash.

title: 43 North London Streets Identified For Lime Bike Docking Bays To Tidy Up Streets - Full List
summary: Brent Council is identifying priority locations for new Lime bike docking stations, following threats to remove Lime bikes due to safety concerns. Lime will invest in new docking stations and reduce its fleet from 750 to 500. The first round of consultations involves 43 locations, predominantly in the Kilburn area. Lime also announced a £20m London Action Plan to tackle issues with e-bike parking across the city.

title: Tfl Paid Out More Than £250K In Injury Claims On The London Underground Last Year
summary: Transport for London paid over £250,000 in injury claims on the London Underground in the year ending April 2024. The highest claims were for £82,635, £55,000, and £37,500. Six claims were made for incidents relating to train doors, totaling £17,490. A passenger received £7,500 for an injury in a lift, and two claims were made for injuries from ticket barriers. No claims were made for incidents involving the gap between Tube trains and the platform.

title: Shoppers Say 'No Need For Botox' Thanks To No7 Anti-Ageing Cream - Now £10 At Boots
summary:
Boots shoppers are praising a night cream that leaves skin looking younger. And not only does it have great reviews, it's also been discounted as part of the retailer's '£10 Tuesday'.
For one day only...

title: Amazon Knocks £84 Off 'Excellent' Tefal Non-Stick Pan Set That 'Heats Quickly And Cooks Evenly'
summary: Amazon has discounted Tefal's Induction Non-Stick Cookware Set by £84, making it more affordable than at Argos. The set includes two frying pans and three saucepans with glass lids, and is suitable for all hobs. Some customers have reported issues with the non-stick coating. Alternative options are available from Lakeland and John Lewis.

title: Teenagers Admit Starting Fire That Killed Pensioner, 76, In His East London Home
summary: Two teenagers pleaded guilty to manslaughter after starting a fire that killed a 76-year-old man in his home in Dagenham, Barking and Dagenham. The teenagers were previously charged with murder and arson, but the Crown Prosecution Service accepted pleas to the lesser charge of manslaughter. The sentencing will take place on April 25.

title: Belvedere Brute Tore Off 'Large Piece' Of Stranger'S Ear During Unprovoked Attack
summary: A man from Belvedere, Greenwich, was jailed for over 7 years for an unprovoked attack on a stranger, tearing off a piece of his ear. The victim was on the phone with his children and sought to avoid confrontation. The assault has had a significant impact on the victim.

title: London Man Arrested Amid Brothel Busting Operation In Barnet
summary: A man from North London was arrested for suspected involvement in a brothel busting operation in Barnet. The operation was carried out by the Modern Slavery and Human Trafficking Unit at Hertfordshire Police. Multiple foreign national women were found at the location and offered help with safeguarding concerns. The operation was intelligence-led and aimed to raise awareness of signs of exploitation.

title: Ex-Met Police Officer Would Have Been Dismissed For Abusing And Harassing Seven Women
summary: A Met Police officer has been dismissed after he was accused of domestic abuse and harassment by seven different women he was in a relationship with. Former Detective Constable (DC) David Fall was acc...

title: Inside The Eerie South London Estate That Was Left Abandoned For Almost 10 Years
summary: An abandoned estate, Maryon Grove in Greenwich, stood empty for almost 10 years before demolition in 2023. The 16-block, 172-home estate was left in decay, filled with leftover furniture and personal items, resembling Chernobyl's abandoned housing blocks. Lovell Homes plans to present new site plans between late 2024 and early 2025.

title: Chelsea Striker Sam Kerr Cleared Of Racially Harassing Met Police Officer
summary: Chelsea striker Sam Kerr was cleared of causing racially aggravated harassment after calling a Metropolitan Police officer "stupid and white". The incident occurred in south-west London in January 2023. Kerr and her partner, Kristie Mewis, were out drinking and were driven to Twickenham Police Station by a taxi driver who complained about clean-up costs and a smashed rear window. Kerr became abusive towards Pc Stephen Lovell, leading to her arrest. The court heard that Kerr felt dismissed and racially targeted by the police. The Crown Prosecution Service initially decided not to charge Kerr, but her legal team attempted to get the case thrown out, arguing there had been an abuse of process.

title: London Street Could Become Monument To Lgbtq+ Rights In Memory Of Men Executed For Being Gay
summary: A Southwark politician is working with local groups to bid for cash for a rainbow plaque commemorating the last two men executed for sodomy in England. The plaque would be erected on Blackfriars Road, where the men were arrested. Southwark has a significant LGBT+ population, with 8.1% of residents identifying as LGB+.

title: Giant 34-Storey South London Tower With 147 Flats Could Be Built Next To London Heliport By Thames
summary: A developer plans to build a 34-story tower with 147 flats near London Heliport in Wandsworth. The tower would replace an empty office building and industrial garages, and would include affordable housing. The developer seeks public feedback and promises improvements to the area.

title: Kate Middleton Defended By Kensington Palace In Rare Statement
summary: Kensington Palace issued a statement denying changes to their policy of sharing information about Princess Kate's outfits, following criticism that media coverage of her fashion choices overshadows her charitable work. The Princess reportedly finds it frustrating when the focus shifts to her appearance instead of her charity endeavors. She has been known to boost sales and endorsements for the fashion industry.

title: First Photos Of Hanwell Murder Scene After Stab Victim Bleeds To Death Outside House
summary: A stabbing incident occurred in Hanwell, Ealing, resulting in a victim's death. The event had a negative impact on the local community.

title: West London Food Supplier Fined £9K For 'Potentially Life Threatening' Spices Imported From Pakistan
summary: A West London food importer and distributor has been fined for failing to ensure essential safety checks on potentially 'toxic food' it brought into the UK. The Southall based company failed council c...

title: M&S 'Moving Into Closed West London Whole Foods' After Shop Has Sat Empty For Months
summary: Former Whole Foods Market in Fulham Broadway, Hammersmith and Fulham will be taken over by Marks and Spencer, after being vacant since last summer. The announcement of Whole Foods Market closing the store was met with local consternation. The Broadway has seen several closures in recent years, but a new JD Wetherspoon is set to open.

title: Man, 60, Dragged Under London Bus Waited Over 2 Hours For Ambulance As Blood Poured From Arm
summary: A man dragged under a double decker bus when the driver pulled away without performing a final check waited more than two hours for an ambulance as his degloved and broken arm poured with blood, a cou...

title: 'I Tried Mcdonald'S Stormzy Meal - The Change In Ordering System Had Staff Turning Down Tips'
summary: A new McDonald's meal, the Stormzy Meal, was launched in Croydon, the artist's hometown. The meal consists of McNuggets, chips, a Sprite, and an apple pie or McFlurry. The ordering process was manual, leading to a noticeable community vibe and warm interactions between staff and customers. The meal will be available across the UK from February 12.

title: Eastenders Fans In Tears As Iconic Characters Return For One-Off Scene
summary: EastEnders fans felt nostalgic and emotional as a scene from the 1980s featuring the Fowler family was aired, paying tribute to the late actors Bill Treacher and Wendy Richard who played Arthur and Pauline Fowler.

title: First Picture Of Dagenham Gunmaker Who Converted Weapons Linked To Murders In His Garden Shed
summary: A man was sentenced to 10.5 years in prison for manufacturing firearms from Turkish-manufactured blank firers in his garden shed. These guns have been used in murders and are being converted using household tools. A national amnesty is underway to take as many of these guns off the streets as possible.
